ManSection.Returns: true if bmat is the blist list of an abstract unital.
ManSection.Description: Each row of bmat corresponds to a block of the unital. We check the sizes of the blocks and the sizes of the intersections of the dual blocks. Wrong bmat matrix size drops error.

ManSection.Returns: The list of boolean incidence matrices of size (q^3 + 1) \times q^2(q^2 - q + 1) read from filename.
ManSection.Description: The file filename must be gzipped and must contain nr matrices of dimension mentioned above. The matrices must be 0-1 matrices without any whitespace between the entries in one row and there must not be any empty lines between matrices.
Reads in the incidence matrices from the libraries of unitals shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 3 of the unitals by Betten, Betten and Tonchev.
ManSection.Description: In the paper Unitals and codes by Anton Betten, Dieter Betten and Vladimir D. Tonchev (Discrete Mathematics 267, 2003, 23-33.) 909 unitals of order 3 were constructed. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 4 of the unitals by Krčadinac, Nakić and Pavčević.
ManSection.Description: In the paper The Kramer-Mesner method with tactical decompositions: some new unitals on 65 points by Vedran Krčadinac, Anamari Nakić and Mario Osvin Pavčević (Journal of Combinatorial Designs 19, 2011, 290-303.) 1777 unitals of order 4 were constructed. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.

ManSection.Returns: The nth (abstract) unital of order 3 of the unitals by Krčadinac.
ManSection.Description: In the paper Steiner 2-designs S(2, 4, 28) with nontrivial automorphisms by Vedran Krčadinac (Glasnik Matematički, Vol. 37 (57), 2002, 259-268.) 4466 unitals of order 3 were constructed. This library contains all the unitals of order 3 with nontrivial automorphism group. The incidence matrices of these unitals are shipped with the package.
The function prints the information about the available libraries of unitals.

ManSection.Returns: The list of records containing the triples (b1, b2, list), where any member of the list list is a full point of U w.r.t. the blocks b1, b2.
ManSection.Description: The point P is a full point of U w.r.t. the blocks b1,b2 if P is not contained in b1 or b2, and, the projection with center P from b1 to b2 is a well-defined bijection.

ManSection.Returns: The list of records containing the triples (ind_b1, ind_b2, ind_list), where any member of the list ind_list is an index of a full point of U w.r.t. the blocks corresponding to ind_b1, ind_b2.
ManSection.Description: The point corresponding to the index P is a full point of U w.r.t. the blocks corresponding to the indices ind_b1, ind_b2 if P is not contained in ind_b1 or ind_b2, and, the projection with center P from ind_b1 to ind_b2 is a well-defined bijection.

ManSection.Returns: The list of records containing the quadruples (ind_b1, ind_b2, ind_list, perm_list), where any member of the list ind_list is an index of a full point of U w.r.t. the blocks corresponding to ind_b1, ind_b2 and perm_list contains permutations of the block ind_b1 defined by projections between ind_b1 and ind_b2 with centers from the list of full points ind_list.
ManSection.Description: The permutations in perm_list are constructed the following way: first we project ind_b1 to ind_b2 with center P, where P is the first element of the list of full points ind_list, then we take all projections from ind_b2 to ind_b1 with center Q, where Q ranges through ind_list. All these projections define a permutation on ind_b1, since the projections were well-defined bijections.
